page.title: 05Methodist Chapel, Adbaston
page.content: Offley Marsh Methodist Chapel is a red brick building built in 1875. Services are held fortnightly. Its Minister looks after 4 chapels. The average congregation is 16 people, which includes 2 teenagers but no children. There are no Children's services or Youth Club. People with young children go to larger chapels where these facilities are available. The congregation live within 1 mile of the chapel. It has a Canadian pedal organ which is considered unusual. The Chapel's finances are described as being "in very good order" and "their future is in no danger".
